revised_title: Investigation of Changes in Double-Stars and Binary Combinations
tldr: The author, William Herschel, investigates changes in the relative positions of double-stars over a period of 25 years. He hypothesizes that many double-stars are real binary combinations of two stars held together by mutual attraction. Through a series of observations and calculations, Herschel concludes that the small star in the pair is in a rotating motion around the larger star or both stars move around a common center of gravity.
